title: Odisha runs short of COVID-19 drug Remdesivir amid high demand | Sambad English
description: Bhubaneswar: As the demand for Remdesivir has gone up manifold following the steep rise in COVID-19 cases, there is acute shortage of the drug in Odisha, said Drugs Controller Annada Sankar Das today. The official said, "Distribution of the drug is being completely managed by the Centre. Although it has promised us to provide 21,000 vials […]

title: Phase III Covid-19 Vaccination Drive Likely To Get Delayed In Odisha
description: The phase III vaccination drive covering all eligible beneficiaries above 18 years might get delayed in Odisha, Director of Health & Family Welfare, Bijay Panigrahi informed on Tuesday.

title: COVID-19 Odisha: Vaccine Programme Unlikely From May 1 - Odisha News Insight
description: As per reoprts, the vaccine manufacturers might not be able to deliver vaccines before May 15 to Odisha, even though the state has already placed orders.

title: Odisha Girl Develops Device For COVID Containment Zone Identification - Odisha Bytes
description: Bhubaneswar: Eleven-year-old Pratibha Pallai of Khandagiri in the Odisha capital has developed a device for identification and surveillance of COVID-19 containment zones. The application-based device, ‘Coronavirus Human Detector System’ runs on arduino codes. The user will have to install the application on a laptop and then connect it to the device. The user then sets […]

title: COVID-19: Odisha's Kalahandi testing lab to be functional in a week
description: Collector Harshad Parag Gavali said infrastructure for the lab is ready and instruments will be shipped from Mumbai.

title: COVID-19: Odisha's Paikmal shut down for seven days from today
description: During the period, all business establishments including grocery shops will remain closed to avoid crowds in marketplaces.

title: COVID graph up, tests down in Odisha
description: Sources said, there have been several instances of relatives of COVID patients being denied RT-PCR test due to shortage of kits.

title: Admission to Odisha government schools from today
description: Parents will be informed about the admission time and schedule through the WhatsApp groups formed for implementation of ‘Odisha Siksha Sanjog’ programme.

title: Odisha: Skills of five lakh migrants mapped, but no follow up
description: Besides these unresolved issues, the Odisha government is yet to make anything public about the skill mapping of five lakh migrants.

title: COVID-19: Odisha records all time high test positivity rate
description: The highest TPR of 16.11 pc was recorded on July 24 last year when 1,503 people had tested positive of 9,327 tested.

title: COVID-19: Odisha sends 67 medical oxygen tankers to seven states
description: Bhubaneswar (Odisha) [India], April 26 (ANI): In order to meet the needs of coronavirus patients, Odisha sent a total of 67 tankers carrying 1,268 metric tonne (MT) medical oxygen to seven states till 2 pm on Monday, police officials said.

title: Odisha’s Nuapada a snapshot of how COVID-19 is affecting rural India
description: Nuapada distrct experiences lack of oxygen, callous staff, a swelling number of infection cases and deaths and an administration in denial as COVID-19 wreaks havoc

title: Covid-19 Resurgence: Saviour Odisha To Face Medical Oxygen Crisis! | OTV News
description: While the whole country is reeling under unprecedented Covid-19 pandemic coupled with medical oxygen shortage, Odisha has come to the rescue of many States by sending tons of the life-saving gas.

title: Covid-19 Odisha recovery tally stands at 3, 67,111 as 4180 more patients recover in last 24 Hours - Kalinga TV
description: Covid-19 Odisha recovery tally stands at 3, 67,111 as 4180 more patients recover in last 24 Hours

title: Banking Hour Revised In Odisha Due To Covid-19 Surge, Check New Timings
description: In the wake of resurge in Covid-19 cases, the customer service hours in all banks across Odisha has been changed. Now, the customer service will be available from 10 am to 2 pm. The revised timing has already come into effect from today and continue till May 15.

title: Odisha: Former MP succumbs to Covid-19 | Sambad English
description: Bhubaneswar: A former Parliamentarian died of Covid-19 in Odisha today afternoon. Sugrib Singh, the former MP from Phulbani Lok Sabha constituency, passed away while undergoing treatment at a private hospital in Bhubaneswar. He was 58. Singh was elected to the 14th Lok Sabha after winning the 2004 general polls from Phulbani Lok Sabha constituency on […]

title: Odisha: Puri bans funeral of outsiders at Swargadwar amid Covid spike
description: The district administration has also imposed restrictions on immersion of ashes or 'Asthi Visarjan' at 'Mahodadhi' (Bay of Bengal).The state government has restricted the number of people who could take part in funeral rituals with only 20 persons being allowed

title: COVID-19 Wave 2: ICU Bed Occupancy In Odisha Crosses Last Year's High - Odisha Bytes
description: Bhubaneswar: The number of COVID-19 patients admitted to intensive care units (ICUs) in Odisha has touched 867. The state now has 49075 active cases. While 412 patients were admitted to the ICUs on April 20, the number had mounted to 748 by April 23 with the admission of 336 more patients in just three days. […]

title: Odisha reports 6,599 new COVID-19 cases, 9 deaths in last 24 hours
description: Bhubaneswar (Odisha) [India], April 26 (ANI): As many as 6,599 new COVID-19 cases, 3,464 recoveries and nine deaths were reported in the last 24 hours, informed state health department on Monday.

title: Odisha’s COVID-19 death toll inches closer to 2,000 as 9 more die | Sambad English
description: Bhubaneswar: The number of COVID-19 death cases in Odisha inches closer to 2,000-mark with nine more patients succumbing to the deadly virus in the last 24 hours. The toll stands at 1997. As per the Health and Family Welfare Department, the fresh deaths were reported from six districts. Khordha district recorded highest three deaths. Besides, […]

title: Odisha: Number of daily COVID-19 cases drops by eight per cent amid surge, seven die
description: As a precautionary measure, the State government has sealed all 90 entry points in the two border districts and set up 54 check posts for intensified surveillance on people returning from West Bengal.

title: Odisha government outsources more ambulances as Bhubaneswar battles COVID-19 surge
description: The Bhubaneswar Municipal Corporation now has 44 ambulances including two each that are provided to the offices of three Zonal Deputy Commissioners .

title: COVID-19: Odisha supplies surplus oxygen to different states
description: Amid an acute shortage of medical oxygen in several parts of the country, Odisha is sending the surplus liquid medical oxygen (LMO) to many states.

title: COVID-19 stalks Odisha’s poorly connected Nuapada district
description: Relying on Chhattisgarh for jobs and supplies, Nuapada’s health infrastructure is under severe strain with a test positivity rate of nearly 40%.

title: COVID-19 surge: Odisha tagging oxygen-laden vehicles with GPS
description: The move is expected to help authorities keep a tab on the movement of the vehicles from source points to hospitals

title: Odisha Covid-19 Update: 6,116 More People Test Positive, 7 Fatalities In 24 Hours | OTV News
description: Odisha on Sunday recorded 6,116 Covid-19 cases while seven patients succumbed to the disease in the last 24 hours, said a data released by the State Information and Public Relations (I&PR) Department today morning.

title: Odisha COVID-19 update: Puri’s Lord Jagannath Temple to remain closed for devotees till May 15
description: The rituals related to the Ratha Yatra will begin from Akshaya Tritiya (May 15).

title: Covid-19: Good Samaritans in Odisha offer a bank of oxygen, hope for people in home isolation
description: On Thursday evening, a resident of Civil Township looked everywhere for an oxygen cylinder he needed for a kin who is in home isolation after testing positive.

title: COVID-19: Telangana sends empty tankers to Odisha for procuring oxygen
description: Health Minister E Rajender and Chief Secretary Simesh Kumar saw off the defence flight from Begumpet airport, which is expected to bring the tankers back filled with medical oxygen.

title: Odisha reports record 6,164 fresh Covid cases, seven deaths
description: While 18 districts accounted for 85 pc of the cases, 10 western Odisha districts bordering Chhattisgarh put together 2,652 cases contributing 43 pc of the fresh caseload.

description: As many as 6,164 tested positive on Thursday compared to 4,851 cases on Wednesday.

title: Will Odisha bear the COVID-19 vaccine expenses?
description: State has 1.93 crore population that belong to 18 to 44 years category; 1.16 crore above 45 years are undergoing vaccination

title: Odisha may peak in first week of May with 10,000 COVID-19 cases
description: Clarifying the present oxygen situation in the State, Dr Mohanty said the State is oxygen surplus now and the government is ready to meet the peak time demand.

title: Covid-19: Odisha Govt cancels class 10th board exams
description: Odisha Government on April 21 announced the cancelation of state board exams for class 10th. Samir Ranjan Dash, Education Minister of Odisha said, “The Board of Secondary Education (BSE), Odisha on Wednesday cancelled the class 10th board exams for 2021 across all schools in state in wake of the surge in COVID cases. The results of class 10 students to be prepared by the board on basis of objective criteria”.

title: Despite Covid-19, Odisha sees huge jump in export turnover | Bhubaneswar News - Times of India
description: Odisha has seen a big jump in export turnover in 2020-21 compared to the previous fiscal despite the adverse impact of Covid-19.

title: ICU capacity and hospital beds doubled as COVID-19 cases grow 38 times faster in Odisha
description: As many as 11,808 beds, including 2,018 in ICUs and 782 with ventilators have been set up in over 70 dedicated Covid hospitals so far to tackle the second wave.

title: Odisha sees highest single-day spike in Covid cases, inter-state buses halted

title: With 3,144 COVID-19 cases, four Odisha districts slide into red zone
description: The death of four Covid patients in a day was highest in the last over three months. in December, 2020, four people succumbed when 263 people had tested positive.

title: Odisha shuts down Lingaraj Temple as Covid-19 cases rise in Bhubaneswar
description: In Odisha, the number of new Covid-19 cases jumped to 3664 in the last 24 hours while positivity rate jumped to over 10% forcing the state government to announce a five-fold increase in the number of beds in dedicated Covid Care Centres and hospitals to accommodate patients.

title: COVID-19: Odisha mandates RT-PCR test for people coming back from Kumbh Mela
description: The state government has advised all collectors and Municipal Commissioners to contact all these persons and find out the location, travel plan and advise them to undergo RT-PCR test before boarding train or flight to Odisha.

title: Odisha halts Covid-19 inoculation at 1,035 centres amid shortage of vaccines
description: Only 56,472 people were given jabs at 465 session sites on Saturday against 91,195 who had been vaccinated in 781 centres

title: Odisha reports 3,144 new Covid-19 cases in 24 hrs, 4 more fatalities
description: Odisha's COVID-19 tally mounted to 3,64,594 as 3,144 more people tested positive for  the infection, while four more fatalities pushed the  coronavirus death toll to 1,942
